resources.string: Swipe horizontally between the tiles to display more statistics
Your test could not be evaluated.
Your test is more than 21 days old and is therefore no longer relevant. Please delete the test. You can then add another.
If you have tested positive for coronavirus, you can warn others.
You have not been diagnosed with the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
You have been diagnosed with the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
The evaluation of your PCR test is not done yet.
The evaluation of your rapid test is not done yet.
Your rapid test is more than 48 hours old and will no longer be displayed here.
Take a PCR test to verify this test result.
Your result is not available yet
Help break the chain of infection by informing others.
There is news about your certificates
The print version of the certificate cannot be displayed because the certificate was not issued in Germany
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device."
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device."
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
This event doesn’t start until %2$s on %1$s. Do you want to check in already?
This event is already over. Do you want to check in retroactively?
Record in my contact journal after check-out?
For further information, please see our FAQ page.

"Write down the circumstances that could increase the risk of infection, such as how close you were to other people or the activities you attended along with others. Examples: sitting close together, participating in a sporting activity (eg playing basketball), hanging out in a small space, singing. n n If you become infected, this information can help the NIJZ to identify the potential chains of infection."
You can enter notes here that will help to estimate the risk of infection.
If you remove a place, all the entries for that place will be removed from your journal.
Do you really want to remove this place?
If you remove all places, all the entries for all places will be removed from your journal.
Do you really want to remove all places?
If you remove a person, all the entries for that person will be removed from your journal.
Do you really want to remove this person?
If you remove all people, all the entries for all people will be removed from your journal.
Do you really want to remove all people?
A building is marked with a location flag.
A silhouette of a woman who is walking across a meadow.
Die nachfolgende Liste dient dem zuständigen Gesundheitsamt zur Kontaktnachverfolgung gem. § 25 IfSG.
A closed book with a bookmark
Create a place and add it to your contact journal.
"Create a list of your contacts in the last 14 days, so you'll have a complete list at hand if needed."
You can export your contact journal in plain text format and edit them.
Enter information about the people you have met.
You can remove entries for people and places from your journal at any time. Journal entries will be deleted automatically after 16 days.
Enter information about places where you have had contact with others.
The information recorded in the contact journal is not necessarily related to the exposures reported by the application in the risk state.
You are the only one who can access your journal entries. Your entries will be saved only on your smartphone.
Several people are outside, looking at their smartphones.
For more information, please refer to the privacy notice.
Using this additional feature of the #OstaniZdrav App is voluntary. Only you decide which data on contacts and places you record.
Neither the NIJZ nor any other agency has access to the information you enter in the contact journal. The information is only stored in encrypted form on your Android smartphone.
You will retain full control over all of the information you record.

Please think carefully with whom you share the information recorded in your contact journal, and how you share it. The information is intended to help you remember your contacts - it is not intended for anyone else. If the NIJZ asks for your help in contact tracing, contact journal can help you remember your contacts.

Private individuals as well as companies are not allowed to make you disclose the information you have recorded. Please respect the wishes of anyone who does not want to be recorded in your contact journal.
Enter the data on persons you have met and on places where you have met them.
Create a person and add them to your contact journal.
based on the exposures assessed by the app.
They are not necessarily related to the people and places you have recorded.
based on multiple exposures with low risk.
Please delete the test from the #OstaniZdrav App, so that you can save a new test code here if necessary.
The test result is displayed here for 48 hours.
The rapid test provided no evidence that you have coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.
"The test certificate is available on the 'Certificates' tab."

This certificate is not a travel document.The scientific evidence on COVID-19 vaccination, testing, and recovery continues to evolve, also in view of new virus variants. Before traveling, please check the applicable public health measures and related restrictions applied at the point of destination. Information on the current travel restrictions that apply to EU countries is available at https://reopen.europa.eu/en.

This certificate is not a travel document. The scientific evidence on COVID-19 vaccination, testing, and recovery continues to evolve, also in view of new virus variants. Before traveling, please check the applicable public health measures and related restrictions applied at the point of destination. Information on the current travel restrictions that apply to EU countries is available at https://reopen.europa.eu/en.
Are you planning an event or do you run a business? Create a QR code which your visitors will be able to scan upon arrival.
Help us to improve the app by answering a few simple questions.
Detailed information about this data processing and your consent.
Your consent is voluntary. If you do not give your consent for the purposes of the survey, you will still be able to use the whole app.
You need to be at least 16 years old to give your consent.
Even after you have given your consent, you do not have to participate in the survey. You can stop the survey at any time.
Detailed Information on Data Processing Involved in Taking the Survey
You have already taken the survey. You can only take the survey once per month (error code %1$s).
The time on your smartphone does not match the current time. Please correct the time in your smartphone settings (error code %1$s).
Thank you for wanting to help. Unfortunately, you use a smartphone that does not support the survey for technical reasons (error code %1$s).
For security reasons, you cannot take the survey less than 24 hours after you install or update the app (error code %1$s).
The survey cannot be retrieved right now. Please try again later (error code %1$s).
The survey cannot be retrieved right now. Please update the Google Play Services (error code %1$s).

"By tapping on 'Accept', you consent to the following:
Before your participation link can be shown to you, the authenticity of your app is checked once. For this purpose, a unique identifier is generated by your smartphone and transmitted to Google in the U.S. or other third countries, so that Google can confirm the authenticity of your app to the NIJZ. The identifier contains information about the version of your smartphone and the app. On this basis, Apple [Google] may be able to infer your identity and learn that your smartphone has been authenticated. Google does not receive any other information from the app during this process. This ensures that each user can only participate in the survey once, so as not to distort the statistics."

Help us to improve the #OstaniZdrav by taking a survey on your experience with the app. This will help the NIJZ to assess the effectiveness of the app, improve the app, and understand how warnings delivered through the app affect the behavior of people with an increased risk."
The survey is intended only for people whose app has indicated an exposure with increased risk. The survey is taken on an NIJZ website. To forward you to the website, a survey link will be displayed in the next step. Before it is displayed, however, the authenticity of your app must be confirmed. This requires your consent.
When you tap on the survey link, you will receive additional information about the survey. You will also be asked explicitly to grant your consent again before you start the survey."
Survey to Assess and Improve the #OstaniZdrav

To confirm the authenticity of your app, your smartphone will generate a unique identifier that contains information about the version of your smartphone and the app. This is necessary to prevent users from participating in the survey more than once, as this could distort the results of the survey. Once generated, the identifier will be transmitted once to Google. This may result in data being transferred to the U.S. or other third countries. There, the level of data protection may not be considered equivalent under European law and it may not be possible to enforce your European data protection rights. In particular, there is a possibility that once the transmitted data reaches Google, it may be accessed and analyzed by security authorities in the third country, even if they have no specific grounds for suspicion, for example by linking the data with other information. This only concerns the identifier sent to Google. Google will not receive the other information about your participation in the survey. It may however be possible for Apple [Google] to infer your identity from the identifier and learn that your smartphone has been authenticated.

After the authenticity of your app has been verified, the app forwards you to an NIJZ website, using a custom link to the survey that has been generated for you. This survey link contains a one-time password that is generated by your #OstaniZdrav. When you tap on the survey link and call the website with the survey, the one-time password is stored temporarily in your browser. This screen contains additional information about the survey and handling notes, such as how to start the survey. At the start of the survey, the one-time password is transmitted to the #OstaniZdrav servers, where it is flagged as used. The server then checks whether or not you can take the survey. This ensures that each user can only take the survey once.
Verification of Authenticity and Transfer to a Third Country
The signature of the certificate is invalid. The certificate cannot be used as proof and therefore cannot be imported.
For further information, please see our FAQ page.

You do not have a certificate that meets the ticketing system’s requirements. Please make sure that the spelling of your name in the ticketing system matches the name on your certificates. If you need additional certificates that aren’t available in the app yet, please add them now and then start verification again.
The following certificates meet the provider’s requirements and can be used as proof:
A smartphone is used to scan a QR code from a ticketing system. A connection between the ticketing system and the smartphone is portrayed.

The provider wants to ensure that a valid certificate is available for your booking. Your consent is required to retrieve your ticketing details from the provider and to release your saved certificates.
If you cancel verification, the certificate cannot be verified.
Do you want to cancel verification?
For more detailed information about data processing, please refer to the privacy notice.
By tapping on “Accept”, you consent to the following steps:

The app will retrieve from the provider the name and date of birth of the person specified at the time of booking, the booking details relevant to the verification (e.g. destination country and date of travel) and the certificate requirements specified by the provider for your booking.
Once retrieved, the app will use this data to determine which of your stored certificates can be used.
You are not required to allow verification of your certificate with the Corona-Warn-App. You can also present proof of your vaccination, testing, or recovery status in a different way.
The requirements of the certificate are defined by the provider. The RKI has no influence over this process. Please contact the provider to obtain more information about the certificate requirements.
The identification of suitable certificates takes place locally on your smartphone. No data is sent to the RKI or to the provider.
The RKI does not receive any data regarding your ticketing or the certificates you have saved.
The selected certificate and your booking information will now be sent to the provider’s verification partner. Your consent is required to send your data to the verification partner.
For more detailed information about data processing, please refer to the privacy notice.
By tapping on “Accept”, you consent to the transfer of the following data to the verification partner:
Content and electronic signature of the selected certificate (including name and date of birth of the certificate holder, validity period, issuer and date of issue, vaccine/test/recovery details).
The booking details retrieved from the provider:
Period during which the certificate must be valid (travel duration or event date)
For travel bookings: Country of origin and country of destination or journey
For cross-border travel: Certificate requirements imposed by the destination country
Further certificate requirements on the part of the provider (e.g. which vaccines or test procedures are accepted)

The verification partner checks whether the electronic signature is valid and that the technical expiration date of the certificate has not been reached yet. You can see the technical expiration date and the transmitted certificate contents in the detail view of the certificate in the app.
The certificates contain sensitive health data. Therefore, you should only allow providers that you know and trust to verify your certificates.
The RKI is not responsible for data processing by the provider and the verification partner. Please read their privacy notices to find out how your data is used and for what purposes.
The verification partner notifies the provider of the result immediately. The partner merely communicates whether the verification was successful or not.
The current version of your Corona-Warn-App no longer supports ticket checking. Please update the app and start the ticket check again.
An error occurred when connecting to the provider %1$s. Please contact the provider if the problem persists.
An error occurred when connecting to the provider. Please contact the provider if the problem persists.
An error occurred during data processing. Please try again later.

This provider is unknown to us. For security reasons, verification during ticketing is only possible for known providers. Please contact the provider who gave you this QR code and try to update your app to the latest version.
For further information, please see our FAQ page.
If you have questions, please contact the provider “%s”.
Your certificate does not meet the provider’s requirements
Your certificate could not be verified by the verification partner
Checked by the verification partner on %s
The provider “%s” has been notified that verification was successful.
Your certificate has been verified successfully
Your Internet connection was lost. To complete the validity check for the certificate, please check the connection and try again.
An error occurred. Please try again later or contact the technical hotline via App Information -> User Support.
Private individuals as well as companies are not allowed to make you share a recorded error report with them.
We do not recommend publishing the error reports or sending them by email.

The error report contains sensitive information, such as details of your test result or the infection risk determined for you. It does not contain any information about the QR codes you used when registering your test, any information you recorded in the contact journal, or any information about your identity.

Initially, only you will have access to the error report. You can then decide whether to send the error report to the technical support team, whether to save the error report on your smartphone first, or whether to stop and erase the recorded information. If you first save the error report locally, this will give you the opportunity to view the error report yourself before submitting it to support.
Recording the error report is voluntary.
IDs of the error analyses shared so far

To help the app technical support team with error analysis, you can record an error report from the CWA. When you do so, the individual technical steps and results of app processes are recorded. You can then send the error report to technical support and help to identify and correct the error.
For further information, please see our FAQ page: FAQ for error reports
Detailed Information on Sending Error Reports

To confirm the authenticity of your app, your smartphone generates a unique identifier that contains information about the version of your smartphone and the app. This is necessary to ensure that only people who actually use the #OstaniZdrav can send data to technical support and rule out manipulated error reports. To do so, the identifier is sent to Google. In this process, data may be transferred to the U.S. or other third countries, where the level of data privacy may not correspond to European law and you may not be able to enforce your European rights to data privacy. In particular, security services in the third country could access and analyze the data with Google, even if there is no grounds for suspicion, and link this data with other information, for example. This only involves the identifier that is sent to Google. Google does not receive the information from your error report, however, Google may be able to determine your identity based on the identifier and track that the authenticity check was performed on your smartphone.
"If you do not consent to this transfer of your data to a third country, please do not tap on 'Agree and Send'. You will still be able to use the app, but you cannot send error reports."
Verification of Authenticity and Data Transfer to Third Countries

After the authenticity of your app has been verified, the error report is sent to the NIJZ through a secure connection. Error reports will only be used for troubleshooting and error correction within the framework of future app updates. Only technical support employees can access error reports. Error reports contain a variety of status messages and events that are triggered in the app, but do not contain any information that would enable the NIJZ to determine your identity. Only if you name the error report ID in connection with further messages can a connection be made between the message (and your name contained there, for example) and the information contained in the error report (such as technical messages for calculation as part of exposure logging, information displayed and steps performed in the app, and, where applicable, a retrieved test result and random IDs shared as part of notifying others).
How the NIJZ analyzes the error reports
Detailed Information about This Data Processing and Data Protection Risks in the U.S. and Other Third Countries
Your consent is needed before you can send the recorded error report to NIJZ technical support.

After you send the report, you will receive an error report ID. You can specify this ID to provide technical support with further information, for example, and enable its assignment to your error report. If you do not provide the error report ID, the NIJZ cannot assign the report to you as an individual.
"By tapping on 'Agree and Send', you consent to the following steps:"

If, after sending the report, you have provided your error report ID to the technical support team, then you may also request at any time that the other information you provided, the error report ID, and the error report itself be erased. Otherwise, the error report will be automatically erased after 14 days.

The error report you create will be sent to the NIJZ for error analysis purposes. The NIJZ will analyse the error report in order to be able to identify and fix possible causes of the errors that occur in your app. If you provide the error report ID to the technical support team, then the NIJZ will be able to associate the error report with you personally.

Before the report is sent to the NIJZ, the authenticity of your app is checked once. For this purpose, a unique identifier is generated by your smartphone and transmitted to Google in the US or other third countries, so that Google can confirm the authenticity of your app to the NIJZ. The identifier contains information about the version of your smartphone and the app. Google may thus be able to infer your identity and learn that your smartphone has been authenticated. Google will not receive any further information from the app or the error report during this process.
The error report cannot be sent right now. Please try again later.
You need at least 200 MB of memory to start the error analysis. Please free up memory.
If you do so, all recorded data will be deleted. If you have saved a local copy of the error report, it will not be deleted.
You see the IDs of your error analysis logs here.
The time set on your device does not match the current time. As a result, your risk cannot be checked right now. Please set the correct time in your device settings.
The length of stay will not be adjusted automatically in your contact journal.
You can remain checked in for up to 24 hours. The check-out time must be later than the check-in time.
"This QR code is not a valid certificate. nFor more information on how to obtain a certificate, visit our FAQ page."
The certificate is already registered in your app.
The certificate has been recalled by the issuing authority. Please get a new digital certificate.

"This QR code is not a valid certificate.
For more information about how to receive your certificate, please see our FAQ page."
"The certificate could not be saved on your smartphone. Please try again later or contact the technical hotline under 'App Information'."
An error occurred. Please try again later or contact the technical hotline via App Information -> User Support.
This certificate is no longer current. You can remove it from the #OstaniZdrav.

You cannot request a test certificate because this testing point does not support the issuing of test certificates. Please remove the certificate or contact the technical hotline via App Information -> User Support.
An error occurred. Please try again later or contact the technical hotline via App Information -> User Support.
Your Internet connection was lost. Please check the connection and try again.
Could not establish a connection. Please try again.
Your certificate it not available yet. Please try again. If the error persists, please contact the technical hotline via App Information -> User Support.
The personal information of this vaccination certificate does not match that of the certificates already registered. You can only register certificates for one person in the app.
"This vaccination certificate is not supported in your app version yet. Please update your app or contact the technical hotline under 'App Information'."
Error during communication with Google interface
You cannot perform this action. Please contact the hotline.

Your app was reset due to a technical problem. This has no effect exposure logging or your risk status. You will continue to be notified about exposures and still be able to warn others, should you be tested positive for COVID-19. Please note, however, that the app reset means any read QR codes for the electronic notification of your test results have been lost. In this case, please contact your doctor or the testing lab to find out your test result.

The #OstaniZdrav is running correctly, but we cannot update your current risk status. Exposure logging remains active and is woNIJZng correctly. For further information, please see our FAQ page: https://www.coronawarn.app/en/faq/

"Your #OstaniZdrav is correctly installed, but the 'COVID-19 Exposure Notifications System' is not available on your smartphone’s operating system. This means that you cannot use the #OstaniZdrav. For further information, please see our FAQ page: https://www.coronawarn.app/en/faq/"
You are not connected to the Internet.
You do not have sufficient free memory.
No more exposure checks possible today, as you have reached the maximum number of checks per day defined by your operating system. Please check your risk status again tomorrow.

"Please activate the SYSTEM security certificate T-Systems Enterprise Services GmbH, T-TeleSec GlobalRoot Class 2 on your smartphone. For more information, refer to the FAQs on https://coronawarn.app/en/ under 'CAUSE: 2001'."
Please make sure to get a new digital certificate in time.
The expiration date has passed. Please get a new digital certificate.
Reminders, notes, and general notifications – about your risk status, for example.
Here you can find answers to frequently asked questions about the #OstaniZdrav. You will be forwarded to an external website.

Your smartphone can only receive COVID-19 exposure notifications via Bluetooth, but not send them. This means you can be warned of exposures through this interface, but you cannot warn others of exposures yourself. You can send and receive warnings that result from check-ins.
Your smartphone cannot send or receive COVID-19 exposure notifications via Bluetooth. You can send and receive warnings that result from check-ins.

People who use the app help to trace and break the chains of infection. The app saves your contacts with other devices on your device. The app notifies you if you were in contact with persons in whom SARS-CoV-2 infection was later confirmed. Your identity and privacy are always protected.

The National Institute of Public Health (NIJZ) is the central institution for health protection in Slovenia. The NIJZ provides professional or content support to the application, which is managed and maintained by the Ministry of Public Administration of the Republic of Slovenia. In addition to strict adherence to preventive measures to prevent SARS-CoV-2 infection, the application can further limit the spread of the disease.
A group of persons use their smartphones around town.

"For technical questions about the #OstaniZdrav App, please contact ekc@gov.si.
Working hours: Monday - Friday 8 AM - 10 PM"
A man wears a headset while making a phone call.
More about the #OstaniZdrav App. You will be forwarded to an external web site.
Support for the interoperability of the #OstaniZdrav App was funded by the European Commission.
A hand holds a smartphone displaying a large body of text on the screen. Next to the text is a section symbol representing the imprint.

The #OstaniZdrav App was prepared by the National Institute of Public Health and the Ministry of Public Administration, with the NIJZ taking care of the content of the application and the MJU the technical part. The two are thus common controllers of data that are processed within the #OstaniZdrav App.
A woman uses the #OstaniZdrav on her smartphone. An icon showing a padlock on the background of a shield symbolizes encrypted data.
A hand holds a smartphone displaying a large body of text on the screen. Next to the text is a balance scale that symbolizes legal notices.
A hand holds a smartphone displaying a large body of text on the screen. Next to the text is a tick mark symbolizing that the terms of use have been accepted.

Several countries are working together to enable transnational warnings, using a joint exchange server. For example, contacts with users of the official coronavirus-tracing apps in other participating countries can now be taking into account when calculating your exposure risk.

"The app’s privacy notice (including information about the data processing carried out for the transnational exposure logging feature) can be found in the menu under 'App Information' > 'Data Privacy'."
The following countries currently participate in transnational exposure logging:

To do this, the app downloads lists, which are updated daily, of the random IDs of all users who have shared their test results to warn others via their own app. This list is then compared with the random IDs recorded by your Android smartphone.
A hand holds a smartphone. Europe illustration and the EU flag are in the background.
The terms of use have also been updated,

"The terms of use and privacy notice can also be found in the menu under 'App Information' and in the app description in your app store. The changes will not affect how you use the app. If you continue to use the app or reopen it, we will assume that you agree to the updated terms of use."

"You do not need to change anything to find out whether you have had possible exposures involving app users in the participating countries and are therefore at risk of infection yourself. You just need to make sure that the exposure logging feature is still enabled. Exposure logging will automatically warn you about any possible exposure involving another user of the #OstaniZdrav or any other official coronavirus-tracing app.
If you have enabled the 'COVID-19 Exposure Notifications' functionality on your smartphone, then your Android smartphone continuously generates random IDs and sends them via Bluetooth so that they can be received by other smartphones near you. Your Android smartphone, in turn, receives the random IDs of other smartphones. Your own random IDs and those received from other smartphones are recorded by your Android smartphone and stored there for 14 days.
For exposure logging, the app downloads up-to-date lists every day of the random IDs of all users who have shared their test result (more precisely: their own random IDs) via their official coronavirus-tracing app in order to warn other users. These lists are then compared with the random IDs of other users which have been recorded by your Android smartphone.
The app will inform you if it detects a possible exposure. In this case, the app gains access to the data recorded by your Android smartphone about the possible exposure (date, duration and Bluetooth signal strength of the contact). The Bluetooth signal strength is used to derive the physical distance to the other user (the stronger the signal, the smaller the distance). The app analyses this information in order to calculate your risk of infection and to give you recommendations for what to do next. This analysis is only performed locally on your Android smartphone.
Apart from you, nobody (not even the NIJZ or the health authorities of participating countries) will know whether a possible exposure has been detected and what risk of infection has been identified for you.
The app’s privacy notice (including information about the data processing carried out for the transnational exposure logging feature) can be found in the menu under „App Information' > „Data Privacy'."

Several countries are working together to enable transnational warnings, using a joint exchange server. In other words, contacts with users of the official COVID-19-tracing apps in other participating countries can now be taking into account when calculating your exposure risk.

Several countries have teamed up to enable transnational warnings. In other words, your potential exposure to users of the official coronavirus-tracing apps in all participating countries can now be taken into account.
You can view the participating countries in the exposure logging details.
Your Internet connection may have been lost. Please ensure that you are connected to the Internet.

When a user submits their positive test result (more specifically: their daily keys) to warn others through the exchange server jointly operated by the participating countries, all users of the official coronavirus-tracing apps in all these countries can be warned of their potential exposure.
The certificate was issued by an unauthorized body or was issued incorrectly. Please have an authorized body issue you a new certificate.
More on #OstaniZdrav App is available at cepimose.si website.
Exposure log data is retrieved and synchronized with risk notifications from other users. Your risk is checked automatically several times per day.
Close and prolonged contacts with persons with confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.

Random IDs are combinations of digits and letters generated randomly. They are exchanged between devices in close proximity. Random IDs cannot be traced to a specific person and are automatically deleted after 14 days. Persons diagnosed with coronavirus can opt to share their random IDs of up to the last 14 days with other app users.
The display of exposures in the #OstaniZdrav.
List of received and temporary random IDs saved temporarily in the operating system storage. This list is read when the exposures are checked. All random IDs are automatically deleted after 14 days.

When exposure logging is active, the app evaluates your personal risk of infection. It does this by measuring duration and proximity of your contacts with people who have been diagnosed with coronavirus over the last 14 days.
Another central feature is sharing your positive test result. If you have been confirmed to be infected with SARS-CoV-2, you can inform others and break the chain of transmission.
Exposure logging is one of the three central features of the app. When you activate it, contacts with people’s smartphones are logged automatically.
A smartphone displays various content, numbered 1 to 3.
The following risk status can be shown:
The more people who use the app, the faster we can break chains of infection. Please invite your family and friends to download the app.
A man shares the #OstaniZdrav with four other persons.

"Fighting coronavirus together I’m in on this, you too? https://gov.si/ostanizdrav
"
Switch to clock mode for the time input.
Switch to text input mode for the time input.
Tap to switch to selecting a day
Tap to switch to selecting a year
You can choose which notifications you would like to receive in the Settings.
You can set the following settings:
You can choose which notifications you would like to receive in the Settings.
You can set the following settings:
To display the notification text on the lock screen.
If you do not want the notification text to be visible on the lock screen.
You have new messages from your #OstaniZdrav App.
Please share your test result and warn others.
You have new messages from your #OstaniZdrav.

You have deactivated background updates for the #OstaniZdrav. Please activate background updates to use automatic exposure logging. If you do not activate background updates, you can only start exposure logging manually in the app. You can activate background updates for the app in your device settings.
More protection for you and for us all. By using the #OstaniZdrav we can break infection chains much quicker.
"Turn your smartphone into a coronavirus warning system. Get an overview of your risk status and find out whether you've had close contact with anyone diagnosed with coronavirus in the last 14 days."
If you want, you can use the app to save your digital COVID certificates.
The app logs encounters between individuals by exchanging encrypted, random IDs between their smartphones, whereby no personal data whatsoever is accessed.

"Enable prioritized background activity to allow the app to determine your risk status in the background any time (recommended). This disables battery life optimization for the #OstaniZdrav App only. We do not expect this to cause a significant decrease in your smartphone’s battery life.
If you do not allow this setting, we recommend you to open the app manually at least once every 24 hours."
A group of persons use their smartphones around town.

"Please note that with prioritized background activity disabled, you have to open the app manually at least once every 24 hours to update your risk status.
You can enable prioritized background activity in your settings any time."
Onboarding page 6 of 6: Receive warnings and identify risks
If you allow the app to notify you, you will be able to receive notification of your risk of infection and recommendations for further action.
A woman receives a notification from her #OstaniZdrav.
The app can notify you automatically about your risk status and warn you about new infections of people you have been exposed to. Allow the app now to notify you.
Onboarding page 1 of 6: Fighting coronavirus together

You can help us to improve the #OstaniZdrav. Share the data about your app usage with the NIJZ. This will help the NIJZ assess the app’s effectiveness. Your data will also help to improve the features and usability of the app.
Let us know how you use the app and help us to assess its effectiveness.
A person is holding a smartphone in their hand

If you consent to share your data, the app sends various data to the NIJZ each day. The transmitted data will help us assess the effectiveness of the app and will be analyzed to support the following improvements:

Improved exposure logging – We want to improve the accuracy and reliability of the technical calculation of infection risks. To do so, we will evaluate information about risk exposures and the warnings you see. As a result, we will be able to refine the calculation method.
Improved user guidance in the app
Enable information and assistance in the app
Improve statistics about the course of the pandemic – Your data can help provide insights into how the pandemic is spreading over time and space and help us respond to certain trends more quickly.
Data Processing in the Data Sharing Process
"This information cannot be linked with you personally. Your identity will remain confidential. The information will be analyzed for statistical purposes. It will not be saved for a profile."
Information about the age group you specified.
Information about the time between your last exposure with increased risk and the test registration.
Information about whether you shared your test result and warned others.
If you have retrieved a test result through the app:
If you have warned others about a potential exposure:
Information about whether you canceled the steps for warning others.
Information about whether you provided details about the onset of your symptoms.
Information about when you granted your consent to warn others.
Information about the notification you reached in the context of warning others.
Information about how many hours it took for you to receive your test result.
Information about how many days have passed since the last notification of an increased risk.
Information about how many hours have passed since the test registration.
Changes in the warning history compared to the previous day.
Information about which risk was displayed to you at the time of data transmission.
Information about the basis for calculating the risk status in the context of an exposure.
Information about whether you received a positive or negative test result through the app.
Information about the calculated risk at the time the test was registered.
Information about the time between your last exposure with increased risk and the test registration.
Information about the time between the last notification of an increased risk and the test registration.
Information about whether you shared your test result and warned others.
To this end, the NIJZ collects the following data:
Detailed Information about This Data Processing and Data Protection Risks in the U.S. and Other Third Countries
Onboarding page 2 of 6: Data Privacy. A long text follows. To proceed at any time, use the button at the bottom of the screen.
A woman uses the Corona-Warn-App on her smartphone. An icon showing a padlock on the background of a shield symbolizes encrypted data.
Onboarding page 5 of 6: If You Are Diagnosed with Coronavirus

Your notification is encrypted securely and processed on a secure server. People whose encrypted random IDs your smartphone has collected will now receive a warning along with information about what they should now do.
If you are diagnosed with coronavirus ...
An encrypted positive test diagnosis is transmitted to the system, which will now warn other users.
... please report this in the app. Sharing your information about your diagnosis is voluntary and secure. Please do this for the sake of everyone’s health.
Onboarding page 3 of 6: How to Enable Exposure Logging

Exposure logging works by your Android smartphone receiving, via Bluetooth, encrypted random IDs of other app users and passing your own random IDs to their smartphones. Exposure logging can be deactivated at any time.

"You need to enable exposure logging to find out whether you have had possible exposures involving app users in the participating countries and are therefore at risk of infection yourself. By tapping on the 'Activate exposure logging' button, you agree to enabling the exposure logging feature and to the associated data processing by the app.
In order to use the exposure logging feature, you will also have to enable the 'COVID-19 Exposure Notifications' functionality provided by Google on your Android smartphone and grant the #OstaniZdrav permission to use this.
Your Android smartphone will then continuously generate random IDs and send them via Bluetooth so that they can be received by other smartphones near you. Your Android smartphone, in turn, receives the random IDs of other smartphones. Your own random IDs and those received from other smartphones are recorded by your Android smartphone and stored there for 14 days.
For exposure logging, the app downloads up-to-date lists every day of the random IDs of all users who have shared their test result (more precisely: their own random IDs) via their official coronavirus-tracing app in order to warn other users. These lists are then compared with the random IDs of other users which have been recorded by your Android smartphone.
The app will inform you if it detects a possible exposure. In this case, the app gains access to the data recorded by your Android smartphone about the possible exposure (date, duration and Bluetooth signal strength of the contact). The Bluetooth signal strength is used to derive the physical distance to the other user (the stronger the signal, the smaller the distance). The app analyses this information in order to calculate your risk of infection and to give you recommendations for what to do next. This analysis is only performed locally on your Android smartphone.
Apart from you, nobody (not even the NIJZ or the health authorities of participating countries) will know whether a possible exposure has been detected and what risk of infection has been identified for you.
You can withdraw your consent to the exposure logging feature at any time by either disabling the feature using the toggle switch in the app or deleting the app. If you would like to use the exposure logging feature again, you can toggle the feature back on or reinstall the app. If you disable the exposure logging feature, the app will no longer check for possible exposures. If you also wish to stop your device sending and receiving random IDs, you will need to disable the 'COVID-19 Exposure Notifications' functionality in your Android smartphone’s settings. Please note that the app will not delete your random IDs or those received from other smartphones which have been recorded by this functionality on your Android smartphone. You can only permanently delete these in your Android smartphone settings.
The app’s privacy notice (including information about the data processing carried out for the transnational exposure logging feature) can be found in the menu under 'App Information' > 'Data Privacy'."
The encrypted random IDs only pass information about date, duration, and proximity (calculated from signal strength) to other people. Individuals cannot be identified based on the random IDs.

If you do not activate exposure logging, the app cannot determine your risk status. This means you will not receive any information about your risk in the app. You can reactivate exposure logging at any time.
