resources.string: Three persons have activated exposure logging on their smartphones, which will log their encounters with each other.
The app cannot determine your location. However, the device location setting must be activated to use Bluetooth Low Energy in Android 10 and earlier versions.
To identify whether you are at risk of infection, you must activate exposure logging.
The print version of the certificate cannot be displayed because the certificate cannot be retrieved right now. Please try again later.

You can save the certificate as a PDF document. This step is voluntary. You are the only person who can access the PDF document at first. You can then decide whether you want to save it on your smartphone or import it into other apps.
We recommend that you not publish the PDF document, send it via e-mail, or share it through other apps.
Please note that the PDF document contains sensitive information. We recommend handling it carefully and only showing it to people who you trust and who are authorized to check the certificate.
Please turn on this switch if you are %1$s and are the main user of the app. Your certificates will appear at the top of the list.
A certificate with a QR code symbol on it.
The saved digital vaccination certificates, certificates of recovery, and test certificates are displayed here.
To add a certificate, please scan the corresponding QR code.

"To confirm the authenticity of your app, your smartphone will generate a unique identifier that contains information about the version of your smartphone and the app. This is necessary to prevent data from being transmitted to the NIJZ more than once or in an unauthorised manner, as this could distort the results of the analysis. The identifier will be transmitted to Google. This may result in data being transferred to the U.S. or other third countries. There, the level of data protection may not be considered equivalent under European law and it may not be possible to enforce your European data protection rights. In particular, there is a possibility that once the transmitted data reaches Google, it may be accessed and analyzed by security authorities in the third country, even if they have no specific grounds for suspicion, for example by linking the data with other information. This only concerns the identifier sent to Google. Google will not receive the other information about how you use the #OstaniZdrav. It may however be possible for Google to infer your identity from the identifier and learn that your smartphone has been authenticated.
If you do not consent to this transfer of your data to a third country, please do not tap on 'Accept'. You will still be able to use the app, but not the data sharing feature."
Verification of authenticity and transfer to a third country

"By tapping on 'Accept', you consent to the following:
The app will transmit information it records to the NIJZ, on a daily basis. The data concerns possible exposures and warnings that have been displayed to you, test results you have retrieved, and whether you have warned other users, and information about your smartphone’s operating system. If you have provided further details above (region, age group), then the NIJZ will also receive this information.
The NIJZ will compile this data into statistics and analyze it to assess the effectiveness and functioning of the app, and draw conclusions regarding the pandemic. The resulting knowledge will help to improve the app’s features and make it more user-friendly, as well as to inform other pandemic response measures.
Before your data is analyzed, it is necessary to ensure that each app that shares data is only counted once, so as not to distort the statistics. This is why the authenticity of your app needs to be verified. For this purpose, a unique identifier is generated by your smartphone and transmitted to Google in the U.S. or other third countries, so that Google can confirm the authenticity of your app to the NIJZ. The identifier contains information about the version of your smartphone and the app. On this basis, Google may be able to infer your identity and learn that your smartphone has been authenticated. Google does not receive any other information from the app during this process.
You can withdraw your consent at any time by disabling the data sharing feature in the app's settings."
Your consent is voluntary. If you do not give your consent, you will still be able to use the app.

If you share data about your use of the app, your identity will still be kept secret from the NIJZ. This means the NIJZ will not find out who you are or who you have met. No profiles will be created either.
You need to be at least 16 years old to give your consent.

"By enabling 'Share Data' above, you consent to the following:
The app will transmit information it records to the NIJZ, on a daily basis. The data concerns possible exposures and warnings that have been displayed to you, test results you have retrieved, and whether you have warned other users, and information about your smartphone’s operating system. If you have provided further details above (region, age group), then the NIJZ will also receive this information.
The NIJZ will compile this data into statistics and analyze it to assess the effectiveness and functioning of the app, and draw conclusions regarding the pandemic. The resulting knowledge will help to improve the app’s features and make it more user-friendly, as well as to inform other pandemic response measures.
Before your data is analyzed, it is necessary to ensure that each app that shares data is only counted once, so as not to distort the statistics. This is why the authenticity of your app needs to be verified. For this purpose, a unique identifier is generated by your smartphone and transmitted to Google in the U.S. or other third countries, so that Google can confirm the authenticity of your app to the NIJZ. The identifier contains information about the version of your smartphone and the app. On this basis, Google may be able to infer your identity and learn that your smartphone has been authenticated. Google does not receive any other information from the app during this process.
You can withdraw your consent at any time by disabling 'Share Data' above."

"The Corona-Warn-App may not be used to verify third-party certificates. Use the CovPassCheck app for this purpose.
You can add certificates for up to %d people. You cannot scan any more new certificates for additional people.
You’ll find more information about certificate verification on our FAQ page."

"The Corona-Warn-App cannot be used to verify third-party certificates. Use the CovPassCheck app for this purpose.
You can add certificates for up to %d people. Once this limit is reached, you cannot scan any more new certificates for additional people.
You’ll find more information about certificate verification on our FAQ page."
The selected file may be damaged or password-protected and could not be read. Please select a suitable file.
The QR code is not supported by the Corona-Warn-App. Please select a file with a suitable QR code.
When you scan QR codes for certificate verification during the ticketing process, additional information about the booking provider is retrieved.
The data from the respective QR code is read.
Your test certificates, vaccination certificates, certificates of recovery, and certificates for your family members
Verification of your certificates during ticketing
For information about data processing, please refer to the privacy notice.
No QR code was detected in the selected file. Please choose a different file.
The QR code is not supported by the Corona-Warn-App. Please select a suitable QR code.
Import from a photo or a document
Position the QR code in the frame.
You can create a profile with your personal data, which you can submit via QR code to every participating testing point.
You can create a profile with your personal data, which you can submit via QR code to every participating testing point.
Creating a rapid test profile in the app, and using it, are voluntary.
The app converts the data you enter for your rapid test profile into your personal QR code. The QR code then contains all the data you entered.

At a testing point, you can then have your rapid test profile’s QR code scanned as a means of quickly and securely providing your data to the testing point. The testing point will need your data to carry out the test. However, you do not need the app to provide your data. You decide yourself which data is included in the QR code, and which information you communicate to the testing point by other means.

To begin with, only you will have access to your personal rapid test profile. Other people can only access the personal data contained in your rapid test profile if you show them your rapid test profile’s QR code. This will not provide access to other data from the app (e.g. your check-ins or information in your contact journal).
You have the possibility to delete your rapid test profile at any time. Until then, it will remain stored in the app on your smartphone.

The QR code contains your personal information. Do not provide your personal QR code to anyone if you do not want the data to be read. We do not recommend publishing your personal QR code or sending it by email.
Private individuals as well as companies are not allowed to make you share your rapid test profile with them.
A woman with a smartphone in her hand is standing in front of a building. A QR code symbolizes the rapid test profile to be scanned.
Detailed Information on Data Processing and Your Consent
When you create a rapid test profile, you will not have to fill out your personal data again before every rapid test.
You can create a profile with your personal data, which you can submit via QR code to every participating testing point.
Save time and present your rapid test profile at the testing point.
Please present this QR code at the testing point so your personal data can be recorded more quickly. Also keep your ID card at hand.
Please consider that if you do, the QR code can no longer be used for registration.
Do you want to delete the rapid test profile?
Date of first positive test result (YYYY-MM-DD)
If you remove the certificate of recovery, you can no longer use it as proof in the app.
Do you want to remove the certificate?
will be permanently deleted on %1$s at %2$s
Tap the three dots next to an element to restore it. Elements will be deleted automatically after 30 days.

The certificate will be moved to the recycle bin. You’ll find the recycle bin on the “Status” tab page, under the three dots on the upper right. You can permanently delete or restore it there. The certificate will be deleted automatically after 30 days.
Do you want to delete the certificate?
You will no longer be able to restore its contents.
Do you want to empty the recycle bin?
The restored certificate will be moved to its original location. You will then find it on the “Certificates” tab page.
The QR code has already been registered on your smartphone. The test will be restored from the recycle bin.
The QR code has already been registered on your smartphone. The certificate will be restored from the recycle bin.
The restored test will be moved to its original location. You will then find it on the “Status” tab page.
When you delete certificates and tests, they are moved to the recycle bin and displayed here.
Along with bug fixes, this update also includes new and enhanced features.
If you cancel the test registration, you cannot receive your test result in the app.
For security purposes, your test result is protected with your date of birth. The test result can only be issued if you specify the correct date of birth.
The test certificate is only issued if your test result is negative.
The test certificate is valid proof of a negative test result within the EU (e.g. for travel).
Detailed information about this data processing is available in the privacy notice

To ensure that no one with your QR code can retrieve your test result, it is protected with your date of birth. Your date of birth is transmitted in encrypted form to the laboratory in order to retrieve the test result.
Requesting and using a digital COVID-19 test certificate is voluntary. There are other ways to prove that you have a negative test result.
To create your test certificate, data is transmitted once in encrypted form to the NIJZ. The NIJZ signs this data electronically to confirm its validity. The NIJZ will not store the data.

The COVID-19 test certificate contains the data about your coronavirus test. In cases where you are required by law to prove a negative test result, it is sufficient to show the QR code in the app. Do not provide the test certificate to anyone if you do not want the data to be read.

If you present the QR code of the test certificate in the app and it is scanned using the verification app, others will be able to find out your test result. During verification, the official verification app will also display your name and date of birth.
You have the possibility to delete test certificates in the app at any time. Until then, the test certificates will be stored on your smartphone.
You can use the app to request an official EU COVID digital test certificate, which is then added in the app.
Encounters have not yet been checked.
Activate exposure logging to evaluate your risk status today.
The synchronization of random IDs with the server failed. You can restart the synchronization manually.
Your exposure data is being checked. This may take several minutes. Thank you for your patience.
This may take several minutes. Thank you for your patience.
Why your risk of infection is low

You encountered a person who was later diagnosed with coronavirus. Nevertheless, based on your exposure logging data, your risk of infection is low. The risk is low if your encounter was brief or occurred at a distance. You do not need to worry and there is no specific need for action. We recommend that you adhere to the prevailing rules regarding distancing and hygiene.
Monitor your health even if you have been vaccinated or have recovered from covid-19.
Before coughing or sneezing, cover your mouth and nose with a paper towel, which you then discard, or cough or sneeze into the top of your sleeve.
If you have questions about quarantine measures, please contact your public health department. For more information, please see our FAQ page on quarantine measures.
For more information, please see our FAQ page on quarantine measures.
Working from home: If you are able to, work from home.
Limit contact with other people, especially avoid contact with the elderly and persons with chronic health problems. Wear a mask consistently and follow hygiene
Meetings and events: Avoid visits and activities that involve gathering with other people (clubs, bars, restaurants, cinemas, theaters, sports events).
Public transportation: Avoid public transportation as much as possible, particularly at peak times.
Shopping: Have your groceries delivered or ask someone to shop for you.
If you are at a higher risk of a more severe course of the disease, avoid mass events (especially indoors) or use all available protective measures (masks, vaccination, distance).
At a time when the application warns you of a higher risk, we advise you to follow the Instructions for persons who have been exposed to SARS-CoV-2 infection on the NIJZ website.
Travel: Do not travel by plane or train.
Ensure efficient ventilation of enclosed spaces.
"Wash your hands regularly and thoroughly with soap and water. Do not touch eyes, nose and mouth if you haven't washed or disinfected your hands."
Use a mask in medical institutions, DSO/PSVZ, pharmacies and other closed public spaces, including public transport.
If you experience any of the following symptoms or signs, contact your chosen or on-duty doctor by phone:
You can find testing possibilities here.
Feeling unwell, cold signs, cough, fever, shortness of breath, headache, muscle pains, loss of smell or taste, sore throat.
More information about the testing procedure is available on our FAQ page.
Please remember to open the #OstaniZdrav regularly to check your risk status.
General information on covid-19 is available on the National Institute of Public Health website. " "
Pay attention to your health. In case of signs or symptoms or a positive test for SARS-CoV-2, stay at home and consult with your physician over the phone.
Pay attention to your health. In case of signs or symptoms or a positive test for SARS-CoV-2, stay at home and consult with your physician over the phone.
You will find more information about your exposures in your contact journal.

"You will find more information about your exposures in your contact journal.
There is an increased risk that you have been infected. If you have been infected, you can infect other people, even if you have been vaccinated or have recovered and even if you don’t have any symptoms."
If you can do a self-test.
We recommend that you get vaccinated against covid-19.
You have an increased risk of infection because you were exposed over a longer period of time and at close proximity to at least one person diagnosed with coronavirus.
Your risk of infection is low because no contact was reported with people who where later confirmed to be infected with SARS-CoV-2.

Your risk of infection is low because your contacts with people who were later confirmed to be infected with SARS-CoV-2 were short or long-distance. We recommend that you follow the current recommendations to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV-2 infection.

We assessed your risk of infection locally on your device based on exposure recording data (duration and proximity). Your risk of infection cannot be seen by anyone else and you cannot forward it on to anyone.
Your risk of infection is higher because you have been exposed for a long time and in the vicinity of at least one person who was later confirmed to be infected with SARS-CoV-2.

Your risk of infection can be calculated only for periods during which exposure logging was active. The logging feature should therefore remain active permanently. Exposure logging covers the last 14 days.
The app automatically deletes older logs, as these are no longer relevant for infection prevention.
If exposure logging was active at times during which you encountered other people, your risk of infection can be calculated for this period.

The #OstaniZdrav was installed %d days ago. Your risk of infection is calculated for the periods during which exposure logging was active. If you have encountered other people and exposure logging was active, your risk of infection is calculated.

The #OstaniZdrav was installed today. Your risk of infection is calculated for the periods during which exposure logging was active. If you have encountered other people and exposure logging was active, your risk of infection is calculated.

The #OstaniZdrav was installed yesterday. Your risk of infection is calculated for the periods during which exposure logging was active. If you have encountered other people and exposure logging was active, your risk of infection is calculated.
If you have been infected unknowingly, here’s how you can reduce the risk of infecting others:
Additional information is available on our FAQ page on voluntary self-quarantine.
Additional information is available on our FAQ page on voluntary self-quarantine.
We recommend that you get vaccinated against covid-19.
This is what you should do:
This is what you should do:
This is how your risk is calculated.
This period is included in the calculation.

"The last exposure that resulted in your increased risk was more than 14 days ago. Therefore, your risk of infection has been ranked as low again.
This is what you should do: 1. If you do not have any COVID-19 symptoms, continue to follow the prevailing rules regarding distancing and hygiene. 2. If you have COVID-19 symptoms, we recommend that you contact your doctor and get tested."
Date of first positive test result (YYYY-MM-DD)
Date and Time of Sample Collection (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm Z)
Number in a series of vaccinations
If you activate prioritized background activity, the app can determine your risk status at any time. This disables battery life optimization for the #OstaniZdrav only.
You can activate and deactivate prioritized background activity in your device settings.
"A hand is holding a smartphone, on which an icon for 'Refresh not active' can be seen."
"A hand is holding a smartphone, on which an icon for 'Refresh active' can be seen."
Allow automatic notifications of your COVID-19 risk status.
To activate notifications in the #OstaniZdrav, you must allow notifications in your device settings.
A woman receives a notification from her #OstaniZdrav.
A woman has deactivated notifications for her #OstaniZdrav.
Allow the transmission of your usage behavior.
You will no longer be notified of your exposures and you will no longer be able to warn other users.
Delete all your data in the app.
The exposure log must be deleted separately in your device settings.
You will no longer be notified of your exposures and you will no longer be able to warn other users. This procedure cannot be undone.
Are you sure you want to reset the app?
A hand holds a smartphone displaying a symbol indicating that the app is being reset.
A person has turned off Bluetooth on their smartphone, so an encounter with two other persons is not logged.
Allow creation and sharing of COVID-19 random IDs.

"You need to enable the exposure logging feature so that the app can determine whether you are at risk of infection. The exposure logging feature works transnationally, meaning any possible exposure involving users is also detected by other official coronavirus apps.
The exposure logging feature works by your Android smartphone receiving encrypted random IDs from other app users via Bluetooth and passing your own random IDs to their smartphones. Every day, the app downloads lists containing the random IDs – along with any voluntary information about the onset of symptoms – of all users who have tested positive for the virus and voluntarily shared this information (specifically: their random IDs) via their app. This list is then compared with the random IDs of other users you have encountered that have been recorded by your Android smartphone, in order to calculate the likelihood that you have also been infected and to warn you if necessary.
You can use the toggle switch to disable exposure logging at any time.
Personal data, such as your name, address, or location, is never recorded during exposure logging, nor is this information passed on to other users. It is not possible to use random IDs to draw conclusions about individual persons."
This is how exposure logging works
Three persons have activated exposure logging on their smartphones, which will log their encounters with each other.
A person has deactivated exposure logging on their smartphone, so an encounter with two other persons is not logged.
Bluetooth must be turned on for exposure logging in order to log encounters. Please turn on Bluetooth in your device settings.

Activate your location services. Bluetooth Low Energy requires activated location services to calculate physical distances, but does not access your location. For further information, please see our FAQ page.
The use of this app is intended for persons who are at least 16 years of age and who reside in Republic of Slovenia.
Maximum number of local 7-day incidence figures reached.
Your Internet connection was lost. It was not possible to add a 7-day incidence figure. Please check the connection and try again.
Total number of hospital admissions due to COVID-19 in the last 7 days (by reporting date) per 100,000 residents.

Total number of confirmed new infections in the last 7 days (by reporting date) per 100,000 residents in the configured district or federal state. The hospitalization data refers to the corresponding German state.
For more details about the content of the individual key figures, read our blog.
Number of persons who have been diagnosed with coronavirus and reported to the NIJZ.
Abstract picture of a smartphone with four placeholders for information
Proportion of people in intensive care units due to COVID-19 in relation to total ICU capacity.
COVID-19 Patients in Intensive Care Units
Total number of confirmed new infections in the last 7 days (by reporting date) per 100,000 residents in the configured district or federal state.
Number for the previous day/up to the previous day. If no figures are available yet for the previous day, the last date for which figures are available is displayed.
Total number of confirmed new infections in the last 7 days (by reporting date) per 100,000 residents.
For an interactive presentation of data on vaccines and vaccination against covid-19, visit cepimose.si website.
The assessment of the trend for warnings by app users changes depending on current infection levels, which is why this trend is always displayed as neutral.
The following trends can be shown:

The arrow direction indicates whether the trend is increasing, decreasing, or remaining steady. The color indicates this trend as positive (green), negative (red), or neutral (gray). The trend compares the value from the previous day with the value from two days ago or, for the 7-day trends, the average value from the last 7 days with the average value from the 7 days prior to that.
Number of app users who have been diagnosed with coronavirus and have warned others through the app.
For an interactive display of vaccine and covid-19 vaccination data, visit:
Number of persons reported to the NIJZ who have received all the necessary vaccine doses.
Number of vaccine doses that have been administered nationwide to date.
Number of persons reported to the NIJZ who have received the first dose of the vaccine.
People who have received at least one vaccine dose
Number of persons reported to the RKI who have received a booster vaccination.
People Who Have Received a Booster Vaccination
average infections by each infected person
People Who Have Received at Least One Vaccine Dose
People Who Have Received a Booster Vaccination
If your test result is negative, you can confirm this with an official COVID test certificate. To do so, request the test certificate in the following steps.
Each test can only be scanned once. The app can manage a maximum of one rapid test and one PCR test at the same time.
If you have been diagnosed with coronavirus, you can warn others through the app. If you took a PCR test, the warning feature works in the following countries:
People who were checked in to the same events or places at the same time as you were will also be warned.
Please help others you have encountered by warning them!
Detailed Information on Data Processing and Your Consent
You must be at least 16 years old to grant your consent.
Your consent is required before you can warn others.
In the next step, grant your consent to access the random IDs.
A person is holding a smartphone. A QR code on a test symbolizes the code to be scanned.
Share information about your infection anonymously to alert others.
Your identity and privacy are always protected.
The app will retrieve your test result. If you change your mind later, you can delete the test in the app.
You can withdraw your consent at any time. The setting for this can be found under Display Test. Before sharing your test result, you will be reminded of your consent.

string.name: submission_consent_your_consent_subsection_second_point
string.b: If you have tested positive for coronavirus, the app will share your test result in order to warn other users whom you have encountered. This applies to users of coronavirus-tracing apps from the above countries and users who were simultaneously checked in at the same event or place as you. In the case of rapid tests, only users of the #OstaniZdrav will be warned.

resources.string: "By tapping on 'Accept', you consent to the following steps:"

string.name: submission_consent_your_consent_subsection_third_point
string.b: If you provide additional information about the onset of your symptoms, this will also be shared.

resources.string:
"Please keep your test result (if available) and your phone number ready to request a TAN.
People with hearing impairments can use Tess Relay services (interpreting between German written language and sign language) to contact the phone hotline. You can download the software from Google Play."
If you have any health-related questions, please contact your general practitioner or the medical emergency service hotline, telephone: 116 117.
"Click on the Open \" button to access the NIJZ website"
By entering the data in the form, you will receive a TAN code via SMS.
By entering the data in the online form, you will receive a TAN code via SMS.

"Your entry is used solely for optimizing the data volume.
The list contains all currently participating countries and is continuously updated."
I have visited the following countries

You have already registered a rapid test. The app can manage a maximum of one rapid test and one PCR test at the same time. If you register another rapid test, the first rapid test will be deleted from the app.

You have already registered a PCR test. The app can manage a maximum of one rapid test and one PCR test at the same time. If you register another PCR test, the first PCR test will be deleted from the app.
You have already registered a rapid test.
You have already registered a PCR test.
Find test centers near you. You will be forwarded to an external NIJZ website.
Receive your test result in the app and warn others or request your COVID test certificate.
Share your SARS-CoV-2 infection anonymously by entering the TAN code you received via SMS.
If you have not yet received the TAN code or it has expired, you can obtain it via the online form.
Thanks to your support, other people can now be warned and respond appropriately.
Everyone in the group is happy because someone shared the information on their infection.
Follow the isolation instructions you received from your healthcare provider.
You can now help to improve the accuracy of the warnings. To do so, in the next step, tell us when you first developed symptoms. You can cancel this step at any time.
Several people are looking at their smartphones.
Take a PCR test to verify this test result.
Your input will not be saved.
Do you want to cancel entering your symptoms?
Connection could not be established. Please try again.
Your Internet connection may have been lost. Please ensure that you are connected to the Internet.

"An error has occurred. If you downloaded the app today, you haven't been using it long enough to be able to anonymously notify your contacts. Otherwise, report the error to the e-mail address ekc@gov.si."
Your test is more than 21 days old and can no longer be registered in the app. If you are tested again in future, please make sure to scan the QR code as soon as you get it.
"The TAN is invalid or has already been used. For further information, call the number listed under 'Request TAN'."
An encrypted positive test diagnosis is transmitted to the system, which will now warn other users.
You must be at least 16 years old to grant your consent.
Under \"My Events\" you can see the events you will share with others. You can remove individual logins from the list and not include them in the alert process.
You can abort the key submission process. Sharing the keys will help protect others from infection.
Your identity will remain secret. Other users will not find out who has shared their daily keys.
"By tapping on 'Accept', you consent to the following:"

string.name: submission_no_consent_your_consent_subsection_body_second_part
string.b: The app will share your daily keys to alert other users of official coronavirus-tracing apps. The alert will work in the countries mentioned above. If you provide additional information about the onset of symptoms, these will also be shared. In the next step, please share your daily keys for the last 14 days by tapping Accept.

resources.string: If you have already alerted other users, you can withdraw your consent by deleting the application.
An error has occurred. Call the Technical Assistance Call Center: Application Information - > Technical Assistance Call Center.
Your Internet connection was lost. Please check the connection and try again.
Invalid TAN. Please check your entry or contact the organization that sent you the TAN.
An error occurred. Please try again later or contact the technical hotline via App Information -> User Support.
Which countries have you visited in the last 14 days?
A smartphone transmits an encrypted positive test diagnosis to the system.
Share information about your infection anonymously to alert others.

The QR code is invalid or has been registered on another smartphone already. You will receive your test result from the test center or laboratory regardless of the validity of the QR code. If you are diagnosed with coronavirus, the public health authority will be notified through the legally prescribed channel and will contact you.
Your test could not be evaluated.
You have been diagnosed negative for SARS-CoV-2.
The evaluation of your test is not yet done.
You have been diagnosed positive for SARS-CoV-2.
The public health authority may contact you within the next few days.
Follow the isolation instructions you received from your healthcare provider.
If you have risk factors for severe illness from COVID-19, obtain medical advice. Known risk factors include being over 60 years of age, immunosuppression, diabetes, and obesity.
Share your random IDs to alert the others.
Your test result is not available yet
Try to pinpoint the onset of symptoms as accurately as possible. If you cannot specify an exact date, you can choose from the options listed below. Then click Done.
When did you first notice the symptoms?
"If you do not want to provide information about your symptoms, select 'Skip'."
Have you experienced one or more of the following symptoms?
Enter the 10-digit TAN that you received.
Your entry contains invalid characters. Please check your entry.
Invalid TAN. Please check your entry.
You can also use the finding displayed here as proof of a negative rapid test result.
After you have read your test result, you can notify others if necessary and break the chain of infection.
A woman holds her smartphone in her hand. It is sending a signal to another smartphone.

"Thank you for agreeing to share your test result and helping to warn others as a result.
"If you have not granted your consent to access the random IDs or if more than five days have passed since then, please grant your consent in the next step.

"You have chosen not to share your test result. Others will not be warned.
In the next step, you have the opportunity to change your mind and share your test result after all, to help stop the spread of coronavirus and protect others."

Others you have had contact with will now be warned.
You can now help to improve the accuracy of the warnings. To do so, in the next step, tell us when you first developed symptoms. You can cancel this step at any time.
Thank you for helping to stop the spread of coronavirus.
You have to remove the last test before you can register a new one.

The test result will be moved to the recycle bin. You’ll find the recycle bin on the “Status” tab page, under the three dots on the upper right. You can permanently delete or restore it there. The test result will be deleted automatically after 30 days.
Please activate exposure logging to warn other people.
There was a problem evaluating your test. Please contact the test center or laboratory involved to find out how to proceed.
You have not been diagnosed with the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
The laboratory result indicates no verification that you have coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.
As soon as your test result becomes available, it will be displayed in the app.
Your test result will be added to your contact journal
Your official digital COVID test certificate is not available yet. As soon as it becomes available, it will be displayed in your app.
No official digital COVID test certificate will be issued, as per your request.
An official digital COVID test certificate cannot be issued because this testing point does not support the issuing of test certificates.

"As soon as your test result becomes available, it will be displayed in the app.
You will also receive your test result outside of the app. The public health authorities will notify you, should your test be positive.
If you are notified of a positive test result outside the app, please delete the test currently registered in the app. Call the number shown under 'Request TAN' to get a TAN. You can then use this TAN to register your result in the app and warn others."
Your Test Result Is Not Available Yet
As soon as your test result becomes available, it will be displayed in the app.
Your test result is not available yet
If you want to alert others you need to submit your daily keys.
Don’t you want to send a warning?
Please help curb the spread of infection.

string.name: submission_test_result_positive_no_consent_text_1
string.b: Anonymously share the information about your infection and alert the others.

resources.string: Follow the isolation instructions you received from your healthcare provider.
Your test has been stored in the #OstaniZdrav.
You have granted the following consent:
Detailed Information on Data Processing and Your Consent

In the case of rapid tests, only users of the #OstaniZdrav will be warned. If you provide additional information about the onset of symptoms, this will be also shared."
You can withdraw your consent by disabling 'Warn Others' above."

In the case of rapid tests, only users of the #OstaniZdrav will be warned. If you provide additional information about the onset of symptoms, this will be also shared."
You can withdraw your consent by disabling 'Warn others' above. Your test result will then be shown to you."

If you have tested positive for coronavirus, the app will share your test result in order to warn other users whom you have encountered."
"This warning only affects users who were simultaneously checked in at the same event or place as you and users of coronavirus-tracing apps in the following countries:
Date and Time of Sample Collection
If you remove the certificate, you cannot request it again.
Do you want to remove the certificate?
No certificate can be created for this test. Please add a new test to receive a certificate.
For more information about how to receive your test certificate, please see our FAQ page.
Your certificate is being requested. This may take a few minutes...
There are still problems with the request.
Do you have acute symptoms anyway?
Your result is not yet available
Skipping will not warn any contacts who checked in with you.
Are you sure you don’t want to share your check-ins?
Warn others who checked in with you. Your personal data will not be shared.

"The scanned QR code is not valid for check-ins for an event or place. Please scan a suitable QR code.
(%1$s)"
A building with a QR code symbol in the background.
Check-in prevented due to invalid QR code. The responsible party has to generate a new QR code (error code INVALID_ADDRESS).
Check-in prevented due to invalid QR code. The responsible party has to generate a new QR code (error code INVALID_CRYPTO_SEED).
Check-in prevented due to invalid QR code. The responsible party has to generate a new QR code (error code INVALID_DESCRIPTION).
Check-in prevented due to invalid QR code. The responsible party has to generate a new QR code (error code INVALID_TIMESTAMPS).
Do you really want to remove all entries?
You will no longer be able to warn people who were checked in to this place or event at the same time, nor will you be warned by them.
Do you really want to remove this entry?
The app will store events you have attended in the last 16 days.
The anonymous alert feature allows event attendees to be informed of possible exposure to SARS-CoV-2 infection in the event of a confirmed infection among attendees.

Each check-in is also taken into account when calculating your infection risk status. If an attendee of an event with whom you were in the common room at the same time or up to 30 minutes later is later diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2, you will also be notified.
"By tapping on 'Accept', you consent to the following steps:"
Enter as accurately as possible from when to when you were present at the event, as this will make the calculation of your risk more accurate.

Each check-in is also taken into account when calculating your infection risk status. If someone who has been present at an event or site visit is subsequently diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2, you are also notified anonymously, if you were in the same room with that person at the same time or up to 30 minutes later.

"Each check-in is also taken into account when calculating your infection risk status. If someone who has been present at an event or site visit is subsequently diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2, you are also notified anonymously. if you were in the same room with that person at the same time or up to 30 minutes later. "
Scan the QR code for an event and record your presence at this event or place on your smartphone.
Interrupt chains of infection quickly and reliably
Please consider that if you do, these QR codes can no longer be used for check-ins.
Do you really want to remove all QR codes?
Please consider that if you do, the QR code can no longer be used for check-ins.
Do you want to remove the QR code?
All the QR codes you have created for an event are displayed here. You can delete QR codes that you no longer intend to use.
Select an event for which you want to warn others on behalf of a person who has been diagnosed with coronavirus.
Scan the QR code of the relevant event again to warn on behalf of others.
Select an event for which you want to warn others on behalf of a person who has been diagnosed with coronavirus, or restore a deleted event by scanning the QR code of that event again.
Thanks to your support, other people can now be warned and respond appropriately.
Specify the length of stay of the person who has been diagnosed with coronavirus, on behalf of whom you want to warn others.
You can only warn your guests on behalf of others if you have sent an email requesting a TAN code as the event organiser.
You can warn your guests on behalf of someone who has been diagnosed with coronavirus and who attended the event, but was not checked in with the #OstaniZdrav.

If someone who did not check in to this event or place is diagnosed with coronavirus later, the guests can be notified if they were in the same room at the same time or up to 30 minutes after the diagnosed person.
Increased Safety for You and Your visitors
The more accurate your information, the more reliably your visitors can be warned.
The details of the event will be adequately protected and stored in a QR code, which you can also print out and place in a prominent place at the event.
Your visitors can then scan the QR code using the app.
"At the event, ensure that all protective measures to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV-2 infection and hygiene recommendations are observed and followed. "
Define as precisely as possible the name, type, time and duration of the event you are organizing.
"Tap 'Next', and create a QR code for your visitors."
Please display the QR code in such a way that all your visitors can scan it while observing the social distancing and hygiene rules (at least 2 meters).
One person points to a flip chart, while two people are sitting adjacent and looking at the flip chart.
Increased Safety for You and Your visitors
You can show the QR code to your visitors on your smartphone or in printed form. Place the QR code in a prominent place at the event.
Generate a QR code that your visitors will be able to scan upon arrival. Create a QR code for each event separately.
We recommend that you create a new QR code every day outside of working hours, as this will prevent possible abuse. This is especially recommended for activities with a regular business schedule.

Each check-in is also taken into account when calculating your infection risk status. If someone who has been present at an event is subsequently diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2, you are also notified anonymously, if you were in the same room with that person at the same time or up to 30 minutes later.
You can warn your guests on behalf of someone who has been diagnosed with coronavirus and who attended the event, but was not checked in with the #OstaniZdrav.
The QR code could not be created. Please try again later.
Please adjust the length of your stay if needed.
Notifications about your check-ins, such as automatic check-out.
Specify how long guests usually stay with you.
Please note, you can only use the #OstaniZdrav again once you have installed the latest update.
For further information, please see our FAQ page.
Number in a series of vaccinations
This vaccine only requires one dose.
Add existing certificates for yourself and your family members.
Add your EU digital COVID certificates to the application. In this way, you will be able to prove that you meet the PCT conditions using the application.
For more detailed information about data processing, please refer to the privacy notice.
These certificates are considered to be valid proof within the EU (e.g. for travel).
You can add EU digital COVID vaccination certificates, COVID test certificates, and COVID certificates of recovery in the app.
After you add a certificate, it will remain on your smartphone. It will only be shared with others if you present a certificate for verification.
Using the this function is voluntary. There are other ways to prove that you are fully vaccinated, have a negative test result, or have recovered from a coronavirus infection.
You have the possibility to delete COVID certificates in the app at any time. Until then, the certificates will be stored on your smartphone.

The COVID Certificates contain personal data (involving vaccinations, test results or a previous infection). In cases where you are required by law to show proof, it is sufficient to show the QR code of the certificate in the app. Please note that you may be required to present an identification document during the check. Do not provide certificates and the QR codes to anyone if you do not want the data to be read.

When you present the QR code of a certificate in the app for verification, others will be able to find out whether you have tested negative, are fully vaccinated, or have proof that you have recovered from a coronavirus infection. During verification, the official verification app will also display the name and date of birth. In the case of test certificates, the date of sampling will also be displayed.
There are currently no entry rules for the selected country and selected time for this certificate type. Please note the following:
The expiration date of the certificate must not have passed.
The certificate must have the expected data format.
The signature of the certificate must be valid.
This is a rule of your destination country, %s.
A test certificate must be issued by a certified testing center.
The following rules are not satisfied:
Enter the planned local arrival time at the border of your destination country.
If you are traveling by air, enter the scheduled departure time of your flight.
This is a rule of the issuing country.
The following rules could not be checked. Please make sure that the certificate satisfies the rules of your destination country.
Your certificate could not be validated completely
Your certificate could not be validated
Your certificate is not valid in the selected country
Your certificate is valid in the selected country
Number of destination country rules successfully met: %1$d
The following rules are not satisfied:
Please check in advance whether your certificate will be valid in your destination country at the time of your trip. The entry rules for the selected destination country will be taken into account.
A COVID certificate is valid proof for travel within the EU.
For more detailed information about data processing, please refer to the privacy notice.
Enter your entry date and your local time.
For more information visit re-open EU.
Your Internet connection was lost. To complete the validity check for the certificate, please check the connection and try again.
Please note that entry rules are subject to change. Therefore, please check the certificate shortly before you enter the destination country (max. 48 hours).
Additional rules and restrictions may apply in individual regions.
The #OstaniZdrav does not check whether the data recorded in the certificate is valid.
The current entry rules are downloaded from the NIJZ servers. This requires an internet connection. Access data is transmitted to the NIJZ.
The specified time has already passed. Enter a future time for your local time of entry.
